intro: Banara larensis, commonly known as the African mahogany, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by orange-red berries containing seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its valuable timber, it is also considered an important species for ecological and economic purposes.
